info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 4 at 8:41AM CDT until July 5 at 3:28AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Concho River At Paint Rock affecting Concho County.
For the Concho River...including San Angelo, Paint Rock...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Concho River at Paint Rock.
* WHEN...Until late tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding will occur. A few structures near the banks of the river in Paint Rock will be threatened. Low water crossings and secondary roads will be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 27.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 24.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Friday was 27.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.9 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.3 feet on 09/09/1980. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT
